- [Condition 1]
- [Condition 2]
- [Condition 3]

To restore from archive: [instructions]

### TASK-011: Build Header Compliance Checker Script
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¢ MEDIUM  
**Purpose:** Automate header coverage tracking  
**Estimated Time:** 2-3 hours  
**Assigned To:** Technical lead  
**Deadline:** 2025-11-30  

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Script scans all .md files
- [ ] Detects presence/absence of semantic headers
- [ ] Validates header format against HEADER_STANDARD
- [ ] Generates coverage report
- [ ] Identifies files without headers
- [ ] Outputs actionable list
- [ ] Can be run on-demand or scheduled

**Output Format:**
```
Semantic Header Coverage Report
Generated: 2025-11-01

Total .md files: 145
Files with headers: 58 (40%)
Files without headers: 87 (60%)

Missing Headers:
- /path/to/file1.md
- /path/to/file2.md
[...]

Coverage by Directory:
/auditors/ - 90% (70/80)
/docs/ - 95% (38/40)
[...]
```

### TASK-012: Create Dependency Validator Script
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¢ MEDIUM  
**Purpose:** Validate dependency map accuracy  
**Estimated Time:** 3-4 hours  
**Assigned To:** Technical lead  
**Deadline:** 2025-11-30  

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Script extracts DEPENDS_ON and NEEDED_BY from all headers
- [ ] Builds dependency graph
- [ ] Detects circular dependencies
- [ ] Identifies orphan files
- [ ] Validates referenced files exist
- [ ] Flags broken dependencies
- [ ] Generates validation report

**Validations:**
1. Circular dependency detection
2. Orphan file identification
3. Phantom dependency detection (references to non-existent files)
4. Bidirectional link validation
5. Missing dependencies (files that should depend on others)

### TASK-013: Add Module Docstrings to Python Files
**Priority:** ğŸ”µ LOW  
**Current State:** Python files have no semantic headers (correct)  
**Improvement:** Add comprehensive module docstrings  
**Estimated Time:** 2-3 hours  
**Assigned To:** Technical lead  
**Deadline:** When convenient  

**Target Files:**
- app.py
- pages/landing.py
- pages/console.py
- pages/manual.py
- pages/about.py
- pages/brute_ledger.py
- utils/calculations.py
- utils/visualizations.py
- utils/frameworks.py

**Docstring Format:**
```python
"""
Module: [module_name.py]
Purpose: [what this module does]
Dependencies: [what it imports]
Used By: [what imports it]
Last Updated: [date]

Key Functions:
- function1(): [description]
- function2(): [description]

Example Usage:
    [code example]
"""
```
